until when attains his maturity and reach forty years, he says: my lord! grant
me that I may give thanks for thy favour which thou hast bestowed on me and my
parents, and that I may do good which pleases thee and do good to me in respect
of my offspring; surely I turn to thee, and surely I am of those who submit.

Have they charged each other with
this? Nay! They are an inordinate people.

Then he is of those who believe and charge and another
to show patience, and charge one another to show compassion.

Except those who believe and do well, and enjoin
on each other truth, and enjoin on each other patience.

And do not approach the property of the orphan
except in the best manner until he attains his maturity, and give full measure
and weight with justice ____ we do not impose on any soul a duty except to the
extent of its ability; and when you speak, then be just though it be “against”
a relative and full fill Allah’s covenant; this he has enjoined you with that
you may be mindful;

And Zakariya and Yahya and Isa and Ilyas; every
one was of the good;

And the same did Ibrahim enjoin on his sons and
“so did” Yaqoub. O my sons! Surely Allah has chosen for you “this” faith,
therefore die not unless you Muslims.

Say: o followers of the book! Come to an
equitable proposition between us and you that we shall not serve any but Allah
and “that” we shall not associate ought with him, and “that” some of us shall
not take others for lords besides Allah; but if they turn back, then say: bear
witness that we are Muslims.

All food was lawful to the children of Israel except that which Israel had forbidden to himself,
before that Tavrat was revealed. Say: bring then the Tavrat and read it, if you
are truthful.

And we gave to him Ishaq and Yaqoub; each did we
guide, and Nuh did we guide before, and of his descendants, Dawood and Sulaiman
and Ayub and Yusuf and Haroun; and thus do we reward these who do good “to
others”.

And his wife was standing “by”, so she laughed,
then we gave her the good news of Ishaq and after Ishaq of “a son’s” Yaqoub.

And thus will your lord choose you and teach you
the interpretation of saying and make his favour complete to you and to the
children of Yaqoub, as he made it complete before to your father, Ibrahim and
Ishaq; surely your lord is knowing, wise.

So when he with drew from them and what they
worshipped besides Allah, we gave to him Ishaq and Yaqoub, and each one of them
we made a prophet.

And remember our servants Ibrahim and Ishaq and
Yaqoub, men of power and insight.

Surely we have revealed to you as we revealed to
Nuh and the prophets after him and we revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq
and Yaqoub and the tribes, and Isa and Ayub and Yunus and Haroun and Sulaiman
and we gave to Dawood psalms.

Then his lord chose him, and he made him of the
good.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
If then they believe as you believe in him, they
are indeed on the right course, and if they turn back, then they are only in
great apposition, so Allah will suffice you against them, and he is the
hearing, the knowing.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
All praise is due to Allah, the lord of the
worlds.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Then Adam received “some” words from his lord,
so he turned to him mercifully; surely he is oft ____ returning “to mercy”, the
merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And Allah is the east and the west, therefore
wither you turn, thither is Allah’s purpose; surely Allah is ample giving,
knowing.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Attend constantly to prayers and to the middle
prayer and stand up truly obedient to Allah.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
But if you are in danger, then “say your
prayers” on foot or on horseback; and when you are secure, then remember Allah,
as he has haughty you what you did not know.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Allah is he besides whom there is no god, the
ever living, the self ____ subsisting by whom all subsist; slumber does not
overtake him nor sleep; whatever is in the heavens and what ever is in the
earth is his; who is he that can intercede with him but by his permission? He
knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot comprehend
any thing out of his knowledge except what he pleases, his knowledge except who
he pleases, his knowledge except what he pleases, his knowledge extends over
the heavens and the earth, and the preservation of them both tires him not, and
he is the most high, the great.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Our lord! Make not our hearts to deviate after
thou hast guided us aright, and grant us from thee mercy; surely thou art the
most liberal giver.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! do not go near prayer when
you are intoxicated until you know “well” what you say, nor when you are under
an obligation to perform a total ablution ____ unless “you are” travelling on
the road ____ until you have washed your selves; and if you are sick, or on a
journey, or one of you come from the privy or you have touched the women, and
you cannot find water, betake yourselves to pure earth, then wipe your faces
and your hands; surely Allah is pardoning, forgiving.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when you journey in the earth, there is no
blame on you if you shorten the prayer, if you fear that those who disbelieve
will cause you distress; surely the unbelievers are your open enemy.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! When you rise up to prayer,
wash your faces and your hands as far as the elbows, and wipe your heads and
your feet to the ankles; and if you are under an obligation to perform a total
ablution, then wash “yourselves” and if you are sick or a journey, or one of
you come from the privy, or you have touched the women, and you cannot find
water, betake yourselves to pure earth and wipe your faces and your hands there
with, Allah does not desire to put on you any difficulty, but he wishes to
purify you and that he may complete his favour on you, so that you may be
grateful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Call on your lord humbly and secretly; surely he
does not love those who exceed the limits.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
That Allah might separate the impure from the
good, and put the impure, some of it upon the other, and pile it up together,
then cast it into hell; these it is that are the losers.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say to my servants who believe that they should
keep up prayer and spend out of what we have given them secretly and openly
before the coming of the day in which there shall be no bartering nor mutual
befriending.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Keep up prayer from the declining of the sun
till the darkness of the night and the morning recitation; surely the morning
recitation is witnessed.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And say: my lord! Make me to enter a goodly
entering, and cause me to go forth a goodly going forth,

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say: call upon Allah or call upon, the
beneficent god; whichever you call upon, he has the best names; and do not
utter your prayer with a very raised voice nor be silent with regard to it, and
seek a way between these.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And if you utter the saying aloud, then surely
he knows the secret, and what is yet more hidden,

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Bear then patiently what they say, and glorify
your lord by the praising of him before the rising of the sun and before its
setting, and during hours of the night do also glorify “him” and during parts
of the day, that you may be well pleased.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And enjoin prayer on your followers, and
steadily ad here to it; we do not ask you for subsistence; we do give you
subsistence, and the “good” end is for guarding “against evil”.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And to every nation we appointed acts of
devotion that they may mention on the name of Allah on what he has given them
of the cattle quadrupeds; so your god is one god, therefore to him should you
submit, and give good news to the humble.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
“To” those hose hearts tremble when
Allah is mentioned, and those who are patient under that which afflicts them,
and those who keep up prayer, and spend “benevolently” out of what we have
given them.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Successful indeed are the believers,

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And say: o my lord: forgive and have mercy, and
thou art the best of the merciful ones.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And he it is who made the night and the day to
follow each other for him who desires to be mindful or desires to be thankful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And the servants of the beneficent
god are they who walk on the earth in humbleness, and when the ignorant address
them, they say: peace.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
My lord: grant me wisdom, and join me with the
good;

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Recite that which has been revealed to you of
the book and keep up prayer; surely prayer keep “one” away from indecency and
evil, and certainly the remembrance of Allah is the greatest, and Allah knows
what you do.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Therefore glory is to Allah when you enter upon
the time of the evening and when you enter upon the time of the morning.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Those who keep up prayer and pay the poor ____
rate and they are certain of the hereafter.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Only they believe in our communications who,
when they are reminded of them, fall down making obeisance and celebrate the
praise of their lord, and they are not proud.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Remember Allah, remembering
frequently.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Yaseen.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
There fore be patient of what they say, and sing
the praise of your lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And wait patiently for the judgment of your
lord, for surely your are before our eyes, and sign the praise of your lord
when you rise.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Indeed, there is for you a good example in
Ibrahim and those with him when they said to their people: surely we are clear
of you and of what you serve besides Allah; we declare our selves to be clear
of you, and enmity and hatred have appeared between us and you forever until
you believe in Allah alone ____ but not in what Ibrahim said to his father: I
would certainly ask forgiveness for you, and I do not control for you aught
from Allah ____ our lord! On thee do we rely, and to thee do we turn, and to
thee is the eventual coming:

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! When the call is made for
prayer on Friday, then hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave off
trading; that is better for you, if you know.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
But when the prayer is ended, then disperses
abroad in the land seeks of Allah’s grace, and remember Allah much, that you
may be successful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Except those who pray.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: And those who keep a guard on their prayer.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: They shall say: we were not of those who prayed;

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And glorify the name of your lord morning and
evening.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: So woe to the praying ones.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Sayd: I seek refuge in the refuge in the lord of
men.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Who break the covenant of Allah after its
confirmation and cut asunder what Allah has ordered to be joined, and make
mischief in the land; these it is that are the losers.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when we said to the angels: make obeisance
to Adam they did obeisance, but Iblis “did it not”, he refused and he was
proud, and he was one of the unbelievers.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
It is not righteousness that you turn your faces
towards the east and the west, but righteousness is this that one should
believe in Allah and the last day and the angels and the book and the prophets,
and give away wealth out of love for him to the near of kin and orphans and the
needy and the wayfarer and the beggars and for “the emancipation of” the
captives, and keep up prayer and pay the poor ___ rate; and the performers of
their promise when they make a promise, and the patient in distress and
affliction and in time of conflicts ____ these are they who are true “to
themselves” and these are they who guard “against evil”.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Kind speech and forgiveness is better than
charity followed by in jury; and Allah is self – sufficient, forbearing.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Spend “benevolently of the
good things that you earn and or what we have brought forth for you out of the
earth, and do not aim at what is bad that you may spend “in alms” of it, while
you would not take it yourselves unless you have its price lowered, and know
that Allah is self ____ sufficient, praise worthy.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
To make them walk in the right way is not
incumbent on you, but Allah guides aright whom he pleases; and what ever good
thing you spend, it is to your own good; and you do not spend but to seek
Allah’s pleasure; and whatever good things you spend shall be paid back to you
in full, and you shall not be wronged.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
By no means shall you attain to righteousness
until you spend “benevolently” out of what you love; and whatever thing you
spend, Allah surely knows it.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And those who spend their property “in alms” to
be seen of the people and do not believe in Allah nor in the last day; and as
for him whose associate is the shaitan, an evil associate is he!

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And ordain for us good in this world’s life and
in the hereafter, for surely we turn to thee. He said: “as for” my
chastisement, I will afflict with it whom I please, and my mercy encompasses
all things; so I will ordain it “specially” for those who guard “against evil” and
pay the poor ____ rate, and those who believe in our communications.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Those who keep up prayer and spend
“benevolently” out of what we have given them.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Alms are only for the poor and the needy, and
the officials “appointed” over them, and those whose hearts are made to incline
“to truth” and the “ransoming of” captives and those in debts and in the way of
Allah and the way farer; an ordinance from Allah; and Allah is knowing, wise.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
The hypocritical men and the hypocritical women
are all alike; they enjoin evil and forbid good and withhold their hands, they
have forsaken Allah, so he has forsaken them; surely the hypocrites are the
transgressors.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
They who taunt those of the faithful who give their
alms freely, and those who give to the extent of their earnings, and scoff at
them; Allah will pay them back their scoffing, and they shall have a painful
chastisement.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And of the dwellers of the desert are those who
believe in Allah and the latter day and take what they spend to be “means of”
the nearness of Allah and the apostle’s prayers; surely it shall be means of
nearness for them; Allah will make them enter into his mercy; surely Allah is
forgiving, merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And those who are constant, seeking the pleasure
of their lord, and keep up prayer and spend “benevolently” out of what we have
given them secretly and openly and repel evil with good, as for those, they
shall have the “happy” issue of the abode.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say to my servants who believe that they should
keep up prayer and spend out of what we have given them secretly and openly
before the coming of the day in which there shall be no bartering nor mutual
befriending.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And if you turn away from them to seek mercy
from your lord, which you hope for, speak to them a gentle word.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And to every nation we appointed acts of
devotion that they may mention the name of Allah on what he has give them of
the cattle quadrupeds; so your god is one god, therefore to him should you
submit, and give good news to the humble.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And they who when they spend, are neither
extravagant nor parsimonious, and “keep” between these the just mean.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And what ever you layout as usury, so that it
may increase in the property of men, it shall not increase with Allah, and what
ever you give in charity, desiring Allah’s pleasure ____ it is these “persons”
that shall get manifold.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: these are verses of the book of wisdom.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
The sides draw away from “their” beds, they call
upon their lord in fear and in hope, and they spend “benevolently” out of what
we have given them.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say: surely my lord amplifies the means of
subsistence for which he pleases of his servants and straitens “them” for whom
“he pleases”, and what ever thing you spend, he exceeds it in reward, and he is
the best of sustainers.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Surely they who recite the book of Allah and
keep up prayer and spend out of what we have given them secretly and openly,
hope for a gain which will not perish.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when it is said to them; spend out of what
Allah has given you, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: shall we
feed him whom, in Allah pleases, he could feed? You are in naught but clear
error.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And in their property was a portion due to him
who begs and to him who is denied “good”.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Believe in Allah and his apostle, and spend out
of what he has made you to be successors of; for those of you who believe and
spend shall have a great reward.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Surely “as for” the charitable men and the
charitable women and “those who” set a part for Allah a goodly portion, it
shall be doubled for them and they shall have a noble reward.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe I when you consult the apostle,
then offer some thing in charity before your consultation; that is better for
you and purer; but if you do not find, then surely Allah is forgiving,
merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And spend out of what we have given you before
death comes to one of you, so that he should say: my lord! Why didst thou not
respite me to a near term, so that I should have given alms and been of the
doers of good deeds?

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
There fore be careful of “your duty to” Allah as
much as you can, and hear and obey and spend, it is better for your souls; and
whoever is saved from the greediness of his soul, these it is that are the
successful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Lay hold on him, then put a chain on him.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: And those in whose wealth there is a fixed portion.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: And as for him who asks, do not chide “him.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: And with hold the necessaries of life.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Do not go near prayer when
you are intoxicated until you know “well” what you say, nor when you are under
an obligation to perform a total ablution ___ unless “you are” travelling on
the road ____ until you have washed your selves; and if you are sick, or on a
journey, or one of you come from the privy or you have touched the women, and
you cannot find water, betake your selves to pure earth, then wipe your faces
and your hands; surely Allah is pardoning, forgiving.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! when you rise up to prayer,
wash your faces and your hands as far as the elbows, and wipe your heads and
your feet to the ankles; and if you are under an obligation to perform a total
ablution, then wash “your selves” and if you are sick or on a journey, or one
of you come from the privy, or you have touched the women, and you cannot find
water, betake yourselves to pure earth and wipe your faces and your hands there
with, Allah does not desire to put on you any difficulty, but he wishes to
purify you and that he may complete his favour on you, so that you may be
grateful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O men: eat the lawful and good things out of
what is in the earth, and do not follow the foot steps of the shaitan; surely
he is your open enemy

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
All food was lawful to the children of Israel except that which Israel had for bidden to himself,
before the Tavrat was revealed. Say: bring then the Tavrat and read it, if you
are truthful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And as for the two who are guilty of indecency from
among you, give them both a punishment; then if they repent and amend, turn
aside from them, surely Allah is oft ____ returning “to mercy”, the merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
If thou shouldst chastise them, then surely they
are thy servants; and if thou shouldst forgive them, then surely thou art the
wise.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And to those who were jews we made unlawful
every animal having claws, and of oxen and sheep we made unlawful to them the
fat of both, except such as was on their backs or the entrails or what was
mixed with bones: this was a punishment we gave them on account of their
rebellion, and we are surely truthful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say: tell me what Allah has sent down for you of
sustenance, then you make “a part” of it unlawful and “a part” lawful. Say: has
Allah commanded you, or do you forge a lie against Allah?

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Therefore eat of what Allah has given you,
lawful and good “things”, and give thanks for Allah’s favour if him do you
serve.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
That they may witness advantages for them and
mention the name of Allah during stated days over what he has given them of the
cattle quadrupeds, then eat of them and feed the distressed one, the needy.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Fasting is prescribed for
you, as it was prescribed for those before you, so that you may guard “against
evil”.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O children of Adam! Attend to your
embellishments at every time of prayer, and eat and drink and b not
extravagant; surely he does not love the extravagant.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when we made the house a pilgrimage for men
and a “place of” security, and: appoint for your selves a place of prayer on
the standing ____ place of Ibrahim. And we enjoined Ibrahim and Ismail saying:
purify my house for those who visit “it” and those who abide “into” for
devotion and those who bow down “and” those who prostrate them selves.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Most surely the first those appointed for men is
the one at bekka, blessed and a guidance for the nations.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Allah has made the kabba, the sacred house, maintenance
for the people, and the sacred month and the offerings and the sacrificial
animals with garlands; this is that you may know that Allah knows what ever is
in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and that Allah is the knower of
all things.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when we assigned to Ibrahim the place of the
house, saying: do not associate with me aught, and purify my house for those
who make the circuit and stand to pray and bow and prostrate themselves.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when we made the house a pilgrimage for men
and a “place of” security, and: appoint for your selves a place of prayer on
the standing ____ place of Ibrahim. And we enjoined Ibrahim and Ismail saying:
purify my house for those who visit “it” and those who abide “into” for
devotion and those who bow down “and” those who prostrate them selves.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Most surely the first those appointed for men is
the one at bekka, blessed and a guidance for the nations.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Allah has made the kabba, the sacred house, maintenance
for the people, and the sacred month and the offerings and the sacrificial
animals with garlands; this is that you may know that Allah knows what ever is
in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and that Allah is the knower of
all things.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when we assigned to Ibrahim the place of the
house, saying: do not associate with me aught, and purify my house for those
who make the circuit and stand to pray and bow and prostrate themselves.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Surely the safa and the marwa are among the signs
appointed by Allah: so whoever makes a pilgrimage to the house or pays a visit
“to it”, there is no blame on him if he goes round them and whoever does good
spontaneously, then surely Allah is grateful, knowing.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
The pilgrimage is “performed in” the well ____
known months; so whoever determines the performance of the pilgrimage there in
there shall be no inter course nor fornication nor quarrelling amongst one
another; and what good you do, Allah knows it; and make provision, for surely
the provision is the guarding of oneself, and be careful “of your duty” to me,
o men of understanding.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Fulfil the obligation. the
cattle quadrupeds are allowed to you except that which is recited to you, not
violating the prohibition against game when you are entering upon the
performance of the pilgrimage; surely Allah orders what he desires.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Surely “as for” those who disbelieve, and hinder
“men” from Allah’s way and from the sacred mosque which we have made equally
for all men, “for” the dweller there in and “for” the visitor, and whoever
shall incline there in to wrong unjustly, we will make him taste of a painful
chastisement.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Then hasten on from the place from which the
people hasten on and ask the forgiveness of Allah; surely Allah is forgiving,
merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Allah has made the kaaba, the sacred house, a
maintenance for the people, and the sacred month and the offerings and the
sacrificial animals with garlands; this is that you may know that Allah knows
what ever is in the heavens and what ever is in the earth, and that Allah is
the knower of all things.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
That “shall be so”; and whoever respects the
signs of Allah, this surely is “the out come” of the piety of hearts.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation: Surely we have given you kausar.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
To every nation we appointed acts of devotion
which they observe, therefore they should not dispute with you about the matter
and call to your lord; most surely you are on a right way.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And when my servants ask you concerning me, then
surely I am very near; I answer the prayer of the suppliant when he calls on
me, so they should answer my call and believe in me that they may walk in the
right way.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Say: if you love Allah, then follow me, Allah
will love you and forgive you your faults, and Allah is forgiving, merciful.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Do you not see that Allah knows whatever is in
the heavens and whatever is in the earth? Now here is there a secret counsel
between three persons but he is the forth of them, nor “between” five but he is
the sixth of them, nor less than that nor more but he is with them where so
ever they are; then he will is inform them of what they did on the day of
resurrection: surely Allah is cognizant of all things.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Why do not the learned men and the doctors of
law prohibit them from their speaking of what is sinful and their eating of
what is unlawfully acquired? Certainly evil is that which they work.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
O you who believe! Most surely many of the
doctors of law and the monks eat away the property of men falsely, and turn
“them” from Allah’s way; and “as for” those who hoard up gold and silver and do
not spend it in Allah’s way, announce to them a painful chastisement,

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
And we made of them Imams to guide by our
command when they were patient, and they were certain of our communications.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Certainly you will find the most violent of
people in enmity for those who believe “to be” the jews and those who are
polytheists, and you will certainly find the nearest in friend ship to those
who believe “to be” those who say: we are christions; this is because there are
priests and monks among them and because they do not behave proudly.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
They have taken their doctors of law and their
monks for lords besides Allah, and “also” the messiah son of Marium and they
were enjoined that they should serve and god only, there is no god but he; for
from his glory be what they set up “with him”.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
In houses which Allah has permitted to be
exalted and that his name may be remembered in them; there glorify him there in
in the mornings and the evenings.

chapter: Coloration of Maker – Variegation of Creator
translation:
Then we made our apostles to follow in their
footsteps, and we sent Isa son of Marium after wards, and we gave him the
Injeel; and we put in the hearts of those who followed him kindness and mercy;
and “as for” monkery, they innovated it ____ we did not prescribe it to them
_____ only to seek Allah’s pleasure, but they did not observe it with its due
observance; so we gave to those of them who believed their reward, and most of
them are transgressors.

How do you deny Allah and you were
dead and he gave you life? Again he will cause you to die and again bring you
to life; then you shall be brought back to him.

He it is who created for you all
that is in the earth, and he directed himself to the heaven, so he made them
complete seven heavens, and he knows all things.

And he taught Adam all the names,
then presented them to the angels; then he said: tell me the names of those if
you are right.

“All” people are a single nation;
so Allah raised prophets as bearers of good news and as warners, and he
revealed with them the book with truth, that it might judge between people in
that in which they differed; and none but the very people who were given it
differed about it after clear arguments and come to them, revolting among
themselves; so Allah has guided by his will those who believe to the truth
about which they differed; and Allah guides whom he pleases to the right path.

O people! Be careful of “your duty
to” your lord, who created you from a single being and created its mate of the
same “kind” and spread from these two, many men and women; and be careful of
“your duty to” Allah, by whom you demand one of another “your – rights”, and
“to” the ties of relationship; surely Allah ever watches over you.

Allah desires that he should make
light your burdens, and man is created weak.

And he it is who has brought you
into being form a single soul, then there is “for you” a resting ____ place and
a depository; indeed we have made plain the communications for a people who
understand.

Say: my lord has enjoined justice,
and set upright your faces at every time of prayer and call on him, being
sincere to him in obedience; s he brought you forth in the beginning, so shall
you also return.

He it is who created you from a
single being, and of the same “kind” did he make his mate, that he might
incline to her; so when he covers her she bears a light burden, then move about
with it; but when it grows heavy, they both call upon Allah, their lord: if
thou givest us a good one, we shall certainly be of the grateful ones.

And people are naught but a single
nation, so they disagree; and had not a ward already gone forth from your lord,
the matter would have certainly been decided between them in respect of that
concerning which they disagree.

And certainly we created man of clay
that gives forth sound, of black mud fashioned in shape.

He created man from a small seed, and
lo! He is an open contender.

And Allah has brought you forth from
the wombs of your mothers ____ you did not know anything ____ and he gave you
hearing and sight and hearts that you may give, thanks.

And man prays for evil as he ought
to pray for good, and man is ever hasty.

And when distress afflicts you in
the sea, away go those whom you call on except he; but when he brings you safe
to the land, you turn aside; and men is ever ungrateful.

And surely we have honoured the
children of Adam, and we carry them in the land and the sea, and we have made
them to excel by an appropriate excellence over most of those whom we have
created.

And when we bestow favour on man, he
turns aside and behaves proudly, and when evil afflicts him, he is despairing.

And certainly we have explained in
this Quran every kind of example; and man is most of all given to contention.

He said: get forth you two there
from, all “of you”, one of you “is” enemy to another. So there will surely come
to you guidance from me, then whoever follows my guidance, he shall not go
astray nor be unhappy;

Man is created of haste; now will I
show to you my signs, therefore do not ask me to hasten “them” on.

O people! If you are in doubt about
the raising, then surely we created you from dust, then from a small seed, then
from a clot, then from a lump of flesh, complete in make and in complete, that
we may make clear to you; and we cause what we please to stay in the wombs till
an appointed time, then we bring you forth as babies, then that you may attain
your maturity; and of you is he who is caused to die, and of you is he who is
brought back to the worst part of life, so that after having knowledge he does
not know anything; and you see the earth sterile land, but when we send down on
it the water, it stirs and swells and brings forth of every kind a beautiful
herbage.

And among men is he who serves Allah
“standing” on the verge, so that is good befalls him he is satisfied there
with, but if a trial afflict him he turns back headlong; he loses this world as
well as the hereafter; that is a manifest loss.
And who guard their private parts,

And certainly we made above you
seven heavens; and never are we heedless of creation.

And when we make people taste of
mercy they rejoice in it, and if an evil befall them for what their hands have
already wrought, lo! They are in despair.

Corruption has appeared in the land
and the sea on account of what the hands of men have wrought, that he may make
them taste a part of that which they have done, so that they may return.

Who made good everything that he has
created, and he began the creation of man from dust.

Surely we offered the trust to the
heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to be unfaithful to
it and feared from it, and man has turned unfaithful to it; surely he is
unjust, ignorant;

And Allah created you of dust, then
of the life ____ germ, then he made you pairs, and no female bears, nor does
she bring forth, except with his knowledge; and no one whose life is lengthened
has his life lengthened, nor is aught diminished of ones life, but it is all in
a book; surely this is easy to Allah.

And the two seas are not alike: the
one sweet, that subdues thirst by its excessive sweetness, pleasant to drink;
and the other salt, that burns by its salt ness, yet from each of them you each
fresh flesh and bring forth ornaments which you wear; and you see the ships
cleave through it that you may seek of his bounty and that you may be grateful.

O men! You are they who stand in
need of Allah, and Allah is he who is the self ____ sufficient, the praised
one.

Do you not see that Allah sends down
water from the cloud, then we bring forth there with fruits of various colors;
and in the mountains are streaks, white and red, of various hues and “others”
intensely black?

Does not man see that we have
created him from the small seed? Then lo! He is an open disputant.

When your lord said to the angels;
surely I am going to create a mortal from dust.

He has created you from a single
being, then made its mate of the same “kind” and he has made for you eight of
the cattle in pairs, he created you in the wombs of your mothers ____ a
creation after a creation ____ in triple darkness; that is Allah your lord, his
is the kingdom; there is no god but he; whence are you then turned away

So when harm afflicts a man he calls
upon us; then, when we give him a favour from us, he says: I have been given it
only by means of knowledge. Nay, it is a trails, but most of them do not know.

Allah is he who made the earth a
resting ____ place for you and the heaven a canopy, and he formed you, then
made goodly your forms, and he provided you with goodly things; that is Allah,
your lord; blessed then is Allah, the lord of the worlds.

And he has made subservient to you
what so ever is in the heavens and what so ever is in the earth, all, from
himself; most surely there are signs in this for a people who reflect.

O you men! Surely we have created
you of a male and a female, and made you tribes and families that you may know
each other; surely the most honourable of you with Allah is the one among you
most careful “of his duty”; surely Allah is knowing, a ware.

Surely man is created of a hasty
temperament;

There surely came over man a period
of time when he was thing not worth mentioning.
And we created you in pairs.

Are you the hander to create or the
heaven? He made it.
Cursed be man! How ungrateful is he!

So let man consider of what he is
created:

And as for man, when his lord tries
him, then treats him with honour and makes him lead an easy life, he says: my
lord honours me.
Nay! I swear by this city
I swear by the fig and the olive.

Most surely man is ungrateful to his
lord.

Allah has cursed him; and he said
most certainly I will take of thy servants an appointed portion:

And say to the believing women that
they cast down their looks and guard their private parts and do not display
their ornaments except what appears there of, and let them wear their head ____
covering over their bosoms, and not display their ornaments except to their
husbands or their fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons, or
the sons of their husbands, or their brothers, or their brother’s sons, or
their sister’s sons, or their women, or those whom their right hands possess,
or the male servants not having need “of women”, or the children who have not
attained knowledge of what is hidden of women; and let them not strike their
feet so that what they hide of their ornaments may be known; and turn to Allah
all of you, o believers! So may that you be successful.

So their lord accepted their
prayer: that I will not waste the work of a worker among you, whether male or
female, the one of you being from the other; they there fore, who fled and were
turned out of their homes and persecuted in my way and who fought and were
slain, I will most certainly cover their evil deeds, and I will most certainly
make them enter gardens beneath which rivers flow; a reward from Allah, and
with Allah is yet better reward.

And do not covet that by which Allah
has made some of you excel others; men shall have the benefit of what they
earn; and ask Allah of his grace; surely Allah knows all things.

Allah has promised to the believing
men and the believing women gardens, beneath which rivers flow, to abide in
them, and goodly dwellings in gardens of perpetual abode; and best of all is
Allah’s goodly pleasure ____ that is the grand achievement.

The gardens of perpetual abode which
they will enter along with those who do well from among their parents and their
spouses and their offspring; and the angels will enter in upon them from every
gate:

Who ever does good whether male or
female and he is a believer, we will most certainly make him live a happy life,
and we will most certainly give them their reward for the best of what they
did.

Surely the dwellers of the garden
shall on that day be in an accupation quite happy.

Whoever does an evil, he shall not
be recompensed “with aught” but the like of it, and whoever does well, whether
male or female and he is a believer, these shall enter the garden, in which
they shall be given sustenance without measure.

Then he made of him two kinds, the
male and the female.

Surely the “true” religion with
Allah is Islam, and those to whom the book had been given did not show
opposition but after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves;
and whoever disbelieves in the communications of Allah then surely Allah is
quick in reckoning.

But the firm in knowledge among
them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you and what was
revealed before you, and those who keep up prayers and those who give the poor
____ rate and the believers in Allah and the last day, these it is whom we will
give a mighty reward.

O you who believe! Do not put
questions about things which if declared to you may trouble you, and if you
question about them when the Quran is being revealed, they shall be declared to
you; Allah pardon this, and Allah is forgiving, forbearing.

Say: I do not say to you. I have
with me the treasures of Allah, nor do I know the unseen, nor do I say to you
that I am an angel; I do not follow aught save that which is revealed to me,
say: are the blind and the seeing one alike? Do you not then reflect?

Nay, they reject that of which they
have no comprehensive knowledge, and the final sequel of it has not yet come to
them; even thus did those before them reject “the truth”; see then what the end
of the unjust was.

Alif Lam Ra “this is” a book which we
have revealed to you that you may bring forth men, by their lord’s permission
from utter darkness into light ____ to the way of the mighty, the praised one.

And they ask you about the soul.
Say: the soul is one of the commands of my lord, and you are not given aught of
know ledge but a little.

And those to whom the knowledge has
been given see that which has been revealed to you from your lord, that is the
truth, and it guides into the path of the mighty, the praised.

And the blind and the seeing are not
alike.

What! He, who is obedient during
hours of the night, prostrating himself and standing, takes care of the
hereafter and hopes for the mercy of his lord! Say: are those who know and
those who do not know alike? Only the men of understanding are mindful.

And they did not become divided
until after knowledge had come to them out of envy among themselves; and had
not a word gone forth from your lord till an appointed term, certainly judgment
would have been given between them; and those who were made to in her it the
book after them are most surely in disquieting doubt concerning it.

And we gave them clear arguments in
the affair, but they did not differ until after knowledge has come to them out
of envy among them selves; surely your lord will judge between them on the day
of resurrection concerning that where in they differed.

Read and your lord is most
honourable.

He it is who created for you all
that is in the earth, and he directed himself to the heaven, so he made them
complete seven heavens, and he knows all things.

They ask you concerning the new
moon. Say: they are times appointed for “the benefit of” men, and “for” the
pilgrimage; and it is not righteousness that you should enter the houses at
their backs, but righteousness is this that one should guard “against evil”;
and go into the houses by their doors and be careful “of your duty” to Allah,
that you may be successful.

He it is who made the sun a shining
brightness and the moon a light, and ordained for it mansions that you might
know the computation of year and the reckoning. Allah did not create it but
with truth; he makes the signs manifest for a people who know.

And certainly we have made
strongholds in heaven and we have made it fair seeming to the beholders.

And we have made the night and the
day two signs, then we have made the sign of the night to pass away and we have
made the sign of the day manifest, so that you may seek grace from your lord,
and that you might know the numbering of years and the rechoning; and we have
explained everything with distinctness.

And he it is who created the night
and the day and the sun and the moon; all “arbs” travel along swiftly in their
celestial spheres.

And certainly we made above you
seven heavens; and never are we heedless of creation.

And a sign to them is the night; we
draw forth from it the day, then lo! They are in the dark;

Surely we have adorned the nearest
heaven with an adornment, the stars.

And certainly we have adorned this
lower heaven with lamps and we have made these missiles for the shaitans, and
we have prepared for them the chastisement of burning.

I swear by the heaven and the comer
by night;

Surely the number of months with
Allah is ordinance since the day when he created the heavens and the earth, of
these four being sacred; that is the right rechoning; therefore be not unjust
to your selves regarding them, and fight the polytheists all together as they
fight you all together, and know that Allah is with those who guard “against
evil”.

And we made above you seven strong
ones.
But nay! I swear by the stars.

O children of Adam! Attend to your
embellishment at every time of prayer, and eat and drink and be not
extravagant; surely he does not love the extravagant.

He it is who makes you travel by
land and sea; until when you are the ships, and they sail on with them in a
pleasant breeze, and they rejoice, a violent wind over takes them and the
billows surge in on them from all sides, and they become certain that they are
encompassed about, they pray to Allah, being sincere to him in obedience: if
thou dost deliver us from this, we will most certainly be of the grateful ones.

Your lord is he who speeds the ship
for you in the sea that you may seek of his grace; surely he is ever merciful
to you.

Do you not see that the ships run on
in the sea by Allah’s favour, that he may show you of his signs? Most surely
there are signs in this for every patient endurer, grateful one.

And he who created pairs of all
things, and made for you of the ships and the cattle what you ride on.

O you who believe! Intoxicants and
games of chance and “sacrificing to” stones set up and “dividing by” arrows are
only uncleanness, the shaitan’s work; shun it therefore that you may be
successful.

And certainly we gave to Dawood
excellence from us: O Mountains! ____ Sing praises with him, and the birds; and
we made the iron pliant to him.

And thus did we make for every
prophet an enemy, the shaitans from among men and jinn, some of them suggesting
to others varnished false hood to deceive “them”, and had your lord pleased
they would not have done it, therefore leave them and that which they forge.
The beneficent God,

Shall I inform you “of him” upon
whom the shaitans descend?

Surely they used to behave proudly
it was said to them: there is no god but Allah;

O you who believe! Intoxicants and
games of chance and “sacrificing to” stones set up and “dividing by” arrows are
only on uncleanness, the shaitan’s work; shun it therefore that you may be
successful.

And “we made” the wind “subservient”
to Sulaiman, which made a month’s journey in the morning and a month’s journey
in the evening, and we made a fountain of molten copper to flow out for him;
and of the jinn there were those who worked before him by the command of his
lord; and who ever turned aside from our command from among them, we made him
taste of the punishment of burning.

What! Do you enjoin men to be good and neglect
your own souls while you read the book; have you then no sense?

And everyone has a direction to which he should
turn, therefore has ten to “do” good works; wherever you are, Allah will bring
you all together; surely Allah has power over all things.

And spend in the way of Allah and cast not
yourselves to perdition with your own hands, and do good “to others”; surely
Allah loves the doers of good.

And what ever good they do, they, they shall not
be denied it, and Allah knows those who guard “against evil”.

And as for the good land, its vegetation springs
forth “abundantly” by the permission of its lord, and “as for” that which is
inferior “its her bage” comes forth but scantily; thus do we repeat the
communications for a people who give thanks.

For those who do well is good “reward” and more
“than this”; and blackness or ignoming shall not cover this faces; these are the
dwellers of the garden; in it they shall abide.

And it is said to those who guard “against evil”
what is it that your lord ahs revealed? They say, well. For those who do good
in this world is good, and certainly the abode of the here after is better; and
certainly most excellent is the abode of those who guard “against evil”;

And whoever does good works and he is a
believer, he shall have no fear of injustice nor of the with holding of his
due.

Repel evil by what is best; we know best what
they describe.

These shall be granted their reward twice,
because they are stead fast and they repel evil with good and spend out of what
we have given them.

And not alike are the good and the evil. Repel
“evil” with what is best, when lo! He between whom and you was enmity would be
as if he were a warm friend.

Whoever does well, it is for his own soul, and
whoever does evil, it is against it; and your lord is not in the least unjust
the servants.

“As for” those who believe and do well, surely
they are the best of men.

What! Do you enjoin men to be good and neglect
your own souls while you read the book; have you then no sense?

Surely the safa and the marwa are among the
signs appointed by Allah; so who ever makes a pilgrimage to the houses or pays
a visit “to it”, there is no blame on him if he goes round them both; and
whoever does good spontaneously, then surely Allah is grateful, knowing.

And if indeed you die or you are slain,
certainly to Allah shall you be gathered together.

Surely Allah does not do injustice to the weight
of an atome, and if it is a good deed he multiplies it and gives from himself a
great reward.

Allah has promised to those who believe and do
good deeds “that” they shall have forgiveness and a mighty reward.

And we have revealed to you the book with the
truth, verifying what is before it of the book and a guardian over it,
therefore judge between them by what Allah has revealed, and do not follow
their low desires “to turn away” from the truth that has come to you; for every
one of you did we appoint a law and a way, and if Allah has pleased he would
have made you “all” a single people, but that he might try you in what he gave
you, therefore strive with one another to hasten to virtuous deeds; to Allah is
your return, of all “of you”, so he will let you know that in which you
differed;

And leave those who have taken their religion
for a play and an idle sport, and whom this world’s life has deceived, and
remind “them” there by lest a soul should be given up to destruction of what it
has earned; it shall not have besides Allah any guardian nor an intercessor,
and if it should seek to give every compensation, it shall not be accepted from
it; these are they who shall given up to destruction for what they earned; they
shall have a drink of boiling water and a painful chastisement because they
disbelieved.

And those who are constant, seeking the pleasure
of their lord, and keep up prayer and spend “benevolently” out of what we have
given them secretly and openly and repel evil with good, as for those, they
shall have the “happy” issue of the abode.

Who ever does good whether male or female and he
is a believer, we will most certainly make him live a happy life, and we will
most certainly give them their reward for the best of what they did.

Surely “as for” those who believe and do good,
we do not waste the reward of him who does a good work.

And Allah increases in guidance those who go
aright; and ever ____ abiding good works are with your lord best in recompense
and in yielding fruit.

whoever brings good, he shall have better than
it, and whoever brings evil, those who do evil shall not be rewarded “for”
aught except what they did

So no soul knows what is hidden for them of that
which will refresh the eyes; a reward for what they did.

and “as for” those who believe and do good, we
will most certainly do away with their evil deeds and we will most certainly
reward them the best of what they did.

And all of them shall surely be brought before
us.

So that Allah will do away with the worst of
what they did and give them their reward for the best of what they do.

That is of which Allah gives the good news to
his servants, “to” those who believe and do good deeds. Say: I do not ask of
you any reward for it but love for my near relatives; and whoever earns good,
we give him more of good there in; surely Allah is forgiving, grateful.

Muhammad is the apostle of Allah, and those with
him are firm of heart against the unbelievers, compassionate among themselves;
you will see them bowing down, prostrating themselves, seeking grace from Allah
and pleasure; their marks are in their faces because of the effect of
prostration; that is their description in the Tavrat and their description in
the Injeel; like as seed ____ produce that puts forth its sprout, then
strengthens it, so it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem, delighting
the sowers that he may enrage the unbelievers on account of them; Allah has
promised those among them who believe and do good, forgiveness and a great
reward.

Except those who believe and do well, and enjoin
on each other truth, and enjoin on each other patience.

So no soul knows what is hidden for them of that
which will refresh the eyes; a reward for what they did.

They ask you concerning the new moon, say: they
are times appointed for “the benefit of” men, and “for” the pilgrimage; and it
is not righteousness that you should enter the houses at their backs, but
righteousness is this that one should guard “against evil”; and go into the
houses by their doors and be careful “of your duty” to Allah, that you may be
successful.

O you who believe! Bow down and prostrate
yourselves and serve your lord, and do good you may succeed.

But when the prayer is ended, then disperses
aboad in the land and seek of Allah’s grace, and remember Allah much, that you
may be successful.
I swear by the night when it draws a veil.
Have we not expanded for you your breast?

And among men is he who sells himself to seek
the pleasure of Allah; and Allah is affectionate to the servants.

And if we had prescribed for them; lay down your
lives or go forth from your homes, they would not have done it except a few of
them; and if they had done what they were admonished, it would have certainly
been better for them and best in strengthening “them”.

And to every nation we appointed acts of
devotion that they may mention the name of Allah on what he has given them of
the cattle quadrupeds; so your god is one god, there fore to him, should you
submit, and give good news to the humble.

O you who believe! Shall I lead you to merchandise
which may deliver you from a painful chastisement?

O you who believe! Do not take for intimate
friends from among others than your own people; they do not fall short of
inflicting loss upon you; they love what distresses you; vehement hatred has
already appeared from out of their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is
greater still; indeed,  we have made the
communications clear to you, if you will understand.

And to everyone we have appointed heirs of what
parents and near relatives leave; and as to those with whom your rights hands
have ratified agreements, give them their portion; surely Allah is a witness
over all thing.

O you who believe! Do not take the unbelievers
for friends rather than the believers; do you desire that you should give to
Allah a manifest proof against yourselves?

O you who believe! Do not take the jews and the
Christians for friends; they are friends of each other; and who ever amongst
you takes them fore a friend, then surely he is one of them; surely Allah does
not guide the unjust people.

And “as for” the believing men and the believing
women, they are guardians of each other; they enjoin good and forbid evil and
keep up prayer and pay the poor ____ rate and obey Allah and his apostle; “as
for” these, Allah will show mercy to them; surely Allah is mighty, wise

And stay in your houses and do not display your
finery like the displaying of the ignorance of yore; and keep up prayer, and
pay the poor ___ rate, and keep up prayer, and pay the poor ____ rate, and obey
Allah and his apostle, Allah only desire to keep away the uncleanness from you,
o people of the house! And to purify you “thorough” purifying.

O you who believe! Do not take my enemy and you
enemy for friends: would you offer them love while they deny what has come to
you of the truth, driving out the apostle and yourselves because you believe in
Allah, your lord? If you go forth struggling hard in my path and seeking my
pleasure, would you manifest love them? And I know what you conceal and what
you manifest; and who ever of you does this, he indeed has gone astray from the
straight path.

And one of his signs is that he created mates
for you from yourselves that you may find rest in them, and he put between you
love and compassion; most surely there are sings in this for a people who
reflect.

O you who believe! Do not violate the signs
appointed by Allah nor the sacred month, for “interfere with” the offerings,
nor the sacrificial animals with garlands, nor those going to the sacred house
seeking the grace and pleasure of their lord; and when you are free from the
obligations of the pilgrimage, then hunt, and let not hatred of a people ____
because they hindered you from the sacred masjid ____ incite you to exceed the
limits, and help one another in goodness and piety, and do not help one another
in sin and aggression; and be careful of “your duty to” Allah; surely Allah is
severe in requiting “evil”.

And “as for” those who disbelieve, some of them
are the guardians of others; if you will not do it, there will be in the land
persecution and great mischief.

And “as for” the believing men and the believing
women, they are guardians of each other; they enjoin good and forbid evil and
keep up prayer and pay the poor ____ rate, and obey Allah and his apostle; “as
for” these, Allah will show mercy to them; surely Allah is mighty, wise.

Surely Allah enjoins the doing of justice and
the doing of good “to others” and the giving to the kindred, and he forbids
indecency and evil and rebellion; he admonishes you that you may be mindful.

And when we made a covenant with the children of
Israel: you shall not serve any but Allah and “you shall do” good to “your”
parents, and to the near of kin and to the orphans and the needy, and you shall
speak to men good words and keep up prayer and pay the poor ____ rate. Then you
turned back except a few of you and “now too” you turn aside.

those who spend “benevolently” in ease as well
as in strait ness, and those who restrain “their” anger and pardon men; and
Allah loves the doers of good “to others”.

And when we made a covenant with the children of
Israel; you shall not serve any but Allah and “you shall do” good to “your”
parents, and to the near of kin and to the orphans and the needy, and you shall
speak to men good words and keep up prayer and pay the poor ____ rate, then you
turned back except a few of you and “now too” you turn aside.

Say: shall I tell you of what is better than
these? For those who guard “against evil” are gardens with their lord, beneath
which rivers flow, to abide in them, and pure mates and Allah’s pleasure; and
Allah sees the servants.

And serve Allah and do not associate any thing
with him, and be good to the parents and to the near of kin and the orphans and
the needy and the neighbour of “your” kin and the alien neighbour, and the
companion in a journey and the farer wayfarer and those whom your right hands
possess; surely Allah does not love him who is proud, boastful;

For this reason did we prescribe to the children
of Israel that whoever slays a soul, unless it be for man slaughter or for
mischief in the land, it is as though he slew all men, and whoever keeps it
alive, it is as though he kept alive all men; and certainly our apostles came
to them with clear arguments, but even after that many of them certainly act
extravagantly in the land.

And those who speak evil things of the believing
men and the believing women without their having earned “it”, they are guilty
indeed of a false accusation and a manifest sin.

O you who believe! Let not “one” people laugh at
“another” people perchance they may be better than they, nor let women “laugh”
at other women, per chance they may be better than they; and do not find fault
with your own people nor call one another by nicknames; evil is a bad name
after faith, and who ever does not turn, these it is that are the unjust.

And those in whose wealth there is a fixed
portion.
And we used not to feed the poor;

But when he tries him “differently”, then
straitens to him his means of subsistence, he says: my lord has disgraced me.

And what will make you comprehend what the
uphill road is?

And away from it shall be kept the turns “his”
back.

Have you considered him who calls the judgment a
lie?

Surely your enemy is the one who shall be
without posterity.
Say: he, Allah, is one.

And who ever among you has not within his power
ampleness of means to marry free believing women, then “he may marry” of those
whom your right hand possess from among your believing maidens; and Allah knows
best your faith: you are “sprung” the one from the other; so marry them with
the permission of their masters, and give them their dowries justly, they being
chaste, not fornicating. Nor receiving paramours; and when they are taken in
marriage, then if they are guilty of indecency, they shall suffer half the
punishment which is “inflicted” upon free women. This is for him among you who
fears falling into evil; and that you abstain is better for you, and Allah is
forgiving, merciful.

This day “all” the good things are allowed to
you; and the food of those who have been given the book is lawful for you and
your food is lawful for them; and the chaste from among the believing women and
the chaste from among those who have been given the book before you “are lawful
for you”; when you have given them their dowries, taking “them” in marriage;
not fornicating nor taking them for paramours in secret; and whoever denies
faith, his work indeed is of no account, and in the hereafter he shall be one
of the losers.
Successful indeed are the believers.

Say to the believing men that they cast down
their looks and guard their private parts; that is purer for them; surely Allah
is aware of what they do.
And those who guard their private parts.

O you who believe! Do not say raina and say
unzurna and listen, and for the unbelievers there is a painful chastisement.

And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet
with a better “greeting” than it or return it; surely Allah takes account of
all things.

And say to my servants “that” they speak that
which is best; surely the shaitan sows dissensions among them; surely the
shaitan is an open enemy to man.

O you who believe! When it is said to you, make
room in “your” assemblies, then make ample room, Allah will give you ample; and
when it is said: rise up, and then rise up. Allah will exalt those of you who
believe, and those who are given knowledge, in high degrees; and Allah is aware
of what you do.

And what will make you comprehend what the
uphill road is?

There is no good in most of their secret
counsels except “in his” who enjoins charity or goodness or reconciliation
between people; and whoever does this seeking Allah’s pleasure, we will give
him a mighty reward.

O you who believe! Obey Allah and obey to
apostle and those in authority from among you; then if you quarrel about any
thing, refer it to Allah and the apostle, if you believe in Allah and the last
day; this is better and very good in the end.
Successful indeed are the believers.

And let those who do not find the means to marry
keep chaste until Allah makes them free from want out of his grace, and “as
for” those who ask for a writing from among those whom your right hands
possess, give them the writing if you know any good in them, and give them of
the wealth of Allah which he has given you: and do not compel your slave girls
to prostitution, when they desire to keep chaste, in order to seek the frail
good of this world’s life; and who ever compels them, then surely after their
compulsion Allah is forgiving, merciful.
And those who guard their private parts.

How do you deny Allah and you were dead and he
gave you life? Again he will cause you to die and again bring you to life; then
you shall be brought back to him.

Alms are only for the poor and the needy, and
the officials “appointed” over them, and those whose hearts are made to incline
“to truth” and the “ransoming of” captives and those in debts and in the way of
Allah and the wayfarer; or ordinance from Allah; and is knowing, wise.
Successful indeed are the believers.

And “as for” women advanced in years who do not
hope for a marriage, it is no sin for them if they put of their clothes without
displaying their ornaments; and if they restrain themselves it is better for
them; and Allah is hearing, knowing.

And they who do not bear witness to what are
false, and when they pass by what is vain, they pass by nobly.

subtag: Mimicry – Mockery – Deliver the Trust – Trust
translation:
And if you are upon a journey and you do not
find ascribe, then “there may be” a security taken into possession; but if one
of you trusts another, then he who is trusted should deliver his trust, and let
him be careful “of his duty to” Allah, his lord; and do not conceal testimony,
and whoever conceals it, his heart is surely sinful; and Allah knows what you
do.

subtag: Mimicry – Mockery – Deliver the Trust – Trust
translation:
And among the followers of the book there are
some such that if you entrust one “of them” with a heap of wealth, he shall pay
it back to you; and among them there are some such that if you entrust one “of
them” with a dinar he shall not pay it back to you except so long as you remain
firm in demanding it; this is because they say: there is no upon us in the
matter of the unlearned people any way “to reproach”; and they tell a lie
against Allah while they know.

subtag: Mimicry – Mockery – Deliver the Trust – Trust
translation:
Surely Allah commands you to make over trusts to
their owners and that when you judge between people you judge with justice;
surely Allah admonishes you with what is excellent; surely Allah is seeing,
hearning.

subtag: Mimicry – Mockery – Deliver the Trust – Trust
translation: And those who are keepers of their prayers;

subtag: Mimicry – Mockery – Deliver the Trust – Trust
translation:
And those are faithful to their trusts and their
covenant.

Allah desires that he should make light your
burdens, and man is created weak.

And say to my servants “that” they speak that
which is best; surely the shaitan sows dissensions among them surely the
shaitan is an open enemy to man.

And when you lay hands “on men” you lay hands
“like” tyrants;

And be not compliant to the unbelievers and the
hypocrites, and leave unregarded their annoying talk, and rely an Allah; and
Allah is sufficient as protector.

O you who believe! Be careful of “your duty to”
Allah and speak the right word.

And not alike are the good and the evil repelling
“evil” with what is best, when lo! He between whom and you was enmity would be
as if he were a warm friend.

Say: my lord has
enjoined justice, and set upright your faces at every time of prayer and call
him, being sincere to him in obedience; as he brought you forth in the
beginning, so shall you also return.

Allah does not forbid
you respecting those who have not made war against you on account of “your”
religion, and have not driven you forth from your homes, that you show them
kindness and deal with them justly; surely Allah loves the doers of justice.

O you who believe! Be
patient and excel in patience and remain stead fast, and be careful of “your
duty to” Allah, that you may be successful.

O you who believe! Be
careful of “your duty to” Allah and speak the right word.

And when we made a
covenant with the children of Israel: you shall not serve any but Allah and
“you shall do” good to “your” parents, and to the near of kin and to the
orphans and the needy, and you shall speak to men good words and keep up prayer
and pay the poor ____ rate. Then you turned back except a few of you and “now
too” you turn aside.

And hold fast by the
covenant of Allah all together and be not disunited, and remember the favour of
Allah on you when you were enemies, then he united your hearts so by his favour
you became brethren; and you were on the brink of a pit of fire, then he saved
you from it; thus does Allah make clear to you his communications that you may
follow the right way.

And whoever among you
has not within his power ampleness of means to marry free believing women, then
“he may marry” of those whom you right hands possess from among your believing
maidens; and Allah knows best your faith; you are “sprung” the one from the
other; so marry them with the permission of their masters, and give them their
dowries justly, being chaste, not fornicating, nor receiving paramours; and
when they are taken in marriage, then if they are guilty of indecency, they
shall suffer half the punishment which is “inflicted” upon free women. This is
for him among you who fears falling into evil; and that you abstain is better
for you, and Allah is forgiving, merciful.

For this reason did we
prescribe to the children of Israel that whoever slays a soul, unless it before
manslaughter or for mischief in the land, it is as though he slew all men; and
whoever keeps it alive, it is as though he kept alive all men, and certainly
our apostles came to them with clear arguments, but even after that many of
them certainly act extravagantly in the land.

The believers are but
brethren, therefore make peace between your brethren and be careful of “your
duty to” Allah that mercy may be had on you.

They ask you about
intoxicants and games of chance. Say; in both of them there is a great sin and
means of profit for men, and their sin is greater than their profit. And they
ask you as to what they should spend. Say: what you can spare, thus does Allah
make clear to you the communications that you may ponder.

“Alms are” for the
poor who are confined in the way of Allah ____ they cannot go about in the
land; the ignorant man thinks them to be rich on account of “their” abstaining
“from begging”; you can recognise them by their mark; they do not beg from men
importunately; and what ever good thing you spend, surely Allah knows it.

And if you take your
turn, then retaliate with the like of that with which you were afflicted; but
if you are patient, it will certainly be best for those who are patient.

These shall be granted
their reward twice, because they are stead fast and they repel evil with good
and spend out of what we have given them.

What ever wealth you
spend, it is for the parents and the near of kin and the orphans and the needy
and the way farer, and what ever good you do, Allah surely knows it.

Alms are only for the
poor and the needy, and the officials “appointed” over them, and those whose
hearts are made to incline “to truth” and the “ransoming of” captives and those
in debts and in the way of Allah and the way farer; an ordinance from Allah;
and Allah is knowing, wise.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
Say: who is it that
delivers you from the dangers of the land and the sea “when” you call upon him
“openly” humiliating yourselves, and in secret; if he delivers us from this, we
should certainly be of the grateful ones.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
Call on your lord
humbly and secretly; surely he does not love those who exceed the limits.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
Surely “as to” those
who believe and do well and humble themselves to their lord, these are the
dwellers of the garden, in it they will abide.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
And Zakariya, when he
cried to his lord: o my lord! Leave me not alone; and thou art the best of
inheritors.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
And to every nation we
appointed acts of devotion that they may mention the mane of Allah on what he
has given them of the cattle quadrupeds; so your god is one god, therefore to
him should you submit, and give good news to the humble.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
Successful indeed are
the believers.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
Say to the believing
men that they cost down their looks and guard their private parts; that is
purer for them; surely Allah is aware of what they do.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly
translation:
“As for” that future
abode, we assign it to those who have no desire to exalt them selves in the
earth nor to make mischief and the good end is for those who guard “against
evil”.

subtag: Supplication – Courtesy – Respect – Begging Praying –Beseeching – Humbly and Secretly

translation:
And do not approach
the property of the orphan except in the best manner until he attains his
maturity; and give full measure and weight with justice ____ we do not impose
on any soul a duty except to the extent of its ability; and when you speak,
then be just though it be “against” a relative, and fulfil Allah’s covenant;
this he has enjoined you with that you may be mindful.

And if two parties of
the believers quarrel, make peace between them; but if one of them acts wrong
fully towards the other, fight that which acts wrong fully until it returns to
Allah’s command; then if it returns, make peace between them with justice and
act equitable; surely Allah loves those who act equitably.

Thus it is due to
mercy from Allah that you deal with them gently, and had you been rough, hard
hearted, they would certainly have dispersed from around you, pardon them there
fore and ask pardon for them, and take counsel with them in the affair; so when
you have decided, then place your trust in Allah; surely Allah loves those who
trust.

And Allah desires that
he should turn to you “mercifully”, and those who follow “their” lusts desire
that you should deviate “with” a great deviation.

Take to forgiveness
